p.s: The author Zia Haider Rahman splits his text in four parts.
The first and second part is informative.
The author wants to wake the readersreader's interests and introduct the theme of the articelarticle.
In the third part the author writes about his own story, how he learned English, when he immigrate in GBGreat Britain.
In this part Zia Haider Rahman wants to show the reader that this is a real problem and not just on the internet, because he must to make it too.
Here the author wants to show, that all of the programmesprograms for immigrants do not work and it is better to think about making English compulsory for all citizens (l. 21).
The author also useuses some stylistic devices to convince the reader of his opinion.
For example, he useuses the metaphor you don't learn to stand on your own two feet (ll. 18-19).
With this metaphor, he wants to show, that it is hard for immigrants to lifelive in GBGreat Britain, because no one tells them about for example the culturculture.
He also useuses the metaphor someone is holding you up (l. 19), to show that there is help, there are people who helps immigrants.
But if we compare this metaphor with the outherother, it becomes clear, that there are not enoughtenough help.
Furthermore he uses the anapheranaphora My parents ... (cf. ll. 11-12, l. 13, l. 14) to keep the readersreader's interests.
In addition Zia Haider Rahman, wants to show how important his parents and family was and is in generallgeneral.
FuthermoreFurthermore the author uses all over the text words like we (cf. l. 3, l. 4, l. 18, l. 20) anand us (l. 23) to break the distance between the author and the reader.
This worlswords include the reader and let them know, that this is a problem, all people have and not just immigrants.

To sum up, the author uses the structure, the stilisticstylistic devices and the personal speech to get the readersreader's attention and to convince the reader of his own opinion, that there is not enough help for immigrants and we must do something.
